column4: Hey all. I'm having an issue with Gnome shell. It seems to be quite laggy. All the animations that should be smooth are jagged, etc. Any ideas how to fix this? I doubt its my system as it's fairly high end

That would make sense. It's also become more noticeable after I started using dual screens. Does Ubuntu have anything to automatically find updated drivers, or should I go to the vender sites manually?
there is a tool called Jockey (it's actually called Additional Drivers in the menu) that you can use to install proprietary drivers
It's not great, but its nothing to worry about. It just means that your GUI is using up a fair bit of your CPU
I see. Is there a way to make that lower? I assume that's also slowing me down and causing this lag
drivers might let your GPU take over more of the load
yeah, once you upgrade to the good aTI drivers, that should improve
Hm, installation of the driver failed
does it say why at all?
Just said to look at /var/log/jockey.log, which makes no sense to me. I tried to install the post-release update one, but for some reason, after failing it deactivated my first one
I'm fairly sure I already had the first one installed from when i set up ubuntu
Oh yeah, it was a huge pain
I at least know whats going on
I see, thanks a lot. I'll let you know if I do get it fixed. It's a damn shame. I basically need to choose between dual displays + lag, or a single display
